results.title: Electrochemistry
results.brief_description: The following phenomena are studied in this film: the electrolytic decomposition of hydrogen chloride; the production of an electric current; the functioning of a storage battery; electroplating and the function of the electrodes; electro-refining and the action of preferential discharge; the precipitation of a solvent; the production of aluminium from a molten electrolyte.

results.title: Electrochemical cells
results.creator_credit: Wexler Film Productions, David W. Ridgway and J. Arthur Campbell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Shows construction and operation of an electrochemical cel1. Time lapse photography of the charges at the electrodes and animated diagrams of the cell processes show the nature of the electrode reactions, the motion of electron and ion currents and the relationship between concentrations and cell voltage Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Electro-magnetic waves. Part 2. Properties and behaviour of electro-magnetic waves
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced Science series. Animated diagrams show how the velocity of electro-magnetic radiation is determined, and the properties of refraction, dispersion, diffraction, interference, polarisation, and absorption of electro-magnetic radiation by the earth’s ionosphere and atmosphere. The uses of different frequencies of electro-magnetic radiation including micro waves for communication and the working of gas and solid state laser.

results.title: Electro-magnetic waves. Part 1. The Discovery and generation of electro-magnetic waves
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced Science series. The discovery of the electro-magnetic spectrum from Newton’s observations on the composition of white light through the discovery of infra-red and ultra violet waves, to the more recent discoveries of radio and gamma waves. Demonstrates methods of generation, and modern uses of electro-magnetic radiation.

results.title: Electro-magnetic induction
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and E Smith Morris
results.brief_description: The generation, by induction, of current in a conductor situated in a magnetic field of changing intensity, is shown by animated diagrams and an electrically operated model railway.

results.title: Electro-magnetic induction
results.brief_description: The relationship between magnetic fields and electric currents; basic principles of electromagnetic induction; production, transmission and use of electricity depends on the basic relationship between electricity and magnetism.

results.title: Electricity: The Story
results.brief_description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.
results.description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.

results.title: Electricity: generation and distribution
results.brief_description: Episode 6 of the series “Is this job for me” on the electricity supply industry. The jobs in the industry are shown by tracing the apprenticeships of two boys who went to the same school; one who enters the generating side and the other the distribution side of industry.

results.title: Electricity: a first film
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean Films and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows how electricity works, how it is generated, and the ways in which it can be utilised. Also demonstrates principles involved in making electromagnets, and safety precautions with electricity. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
